#summary Restoring a persistent object using transactions.

{{{
    Repository tx = repository.begin();
    SimplePersistent obj = (SimplePersistent)tx.restore("1");

    // more code

    tx.commit();
}}}

Begin a transaction and invoke its restore method. If there is no object with the specified identity in the repository, null is returned.

The transactional restore returns the latest value mapped to the specified identity, excluding updates of not-yet-commited transactions.
